title._content: Third page from Miniature Edition of Photographs from the Life

description._content: The album is signed in ink and dated by Julia Margaret Cameron. 2 prints are captioned below in pencil, 2 pencil notes indicating images which were to be pasted in, pencil annotation on leaf laid onto front free end paper “115 little photos now placed & others will be sent to fill in the blanks”, “Hardinge Hay Cameron from his Mother, Julia Margaret Cameron, March 6/7th 1869, Colombo, Ceylon”.Cameron was presented with her first camera in 1863, at the age of 48, and subsequently embraced photography with a passion. She compiled this album in 1869 for her son, Hardinge Hay Cameron. It contains 112 miniature prints of her larger works - portraits of famous men, fair women, literary scenes and religious images. This acquisition was made possible through funding from The Heritage Lottery Fund and from The Art Fund, the UK's leading independent art charity. We're happy for you to share this digital image within the spirit of The Commons. Certain restrictions on high quality reproductions of the original physical version of apply though; if you're unsure please visit the National Media Museum website. For obtaining reproductions of selected images please go to the Science and Society Picture Library.
